Package sorters

Class BinaryTreeSort

  • java.lang.Object
    • sorters.BinaryTreeSort
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    BinaryTreeInterface, Sorter
    public class BinaryTreeSort
extends java.lang.Object
implements BinaryTreeInterface, Sorter
    This class implements the binary tree sort algorithm. See https://tutorialspoint.dev/algorithm/sorting-algorithms/tree-sort for explanation of binary tree sort algorithm. This class implements methods BinaryTreeInterface as well as Sorter.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  BinaryTreeSort.Node
      Instantiate a new node, set its value and store its children.

      The root node is the base value from which the rest of the tree will 'grow' from.

      Begins as a null array.

    • Field Detail

      • rootNode

        private BinaryTreeSort.Node rootNode
        The root node is the base value from which the rest of the tree will 'grow' from. In this application the first value in the unsorted array will always be made the root node.

      • numberOfElements

        private int numberOfElements
        Will equal the number of unique values added to the tree as this method does not handle duplicate values in the unsorted array, it just ignores them.

      • nodeIndex

        private int nodeIndex
        This int will represent the index of the unpopulated sortedArray which the next smallest value in the tree will occupy. It will increment every time a value is added to the sortedArray.

      • sortedArray

        int[] sortedArray
        Begins as a null array. It will be initialised to have the same length as the number of unique values in the tree, then it will be populated with those unique values as the tree is traversed.

      • getSorterName

        public java.lang.String getSorterName()

        Specified by:
        getSorterName in interface Sorter
        Returns:

      • sortArray

        public int[] sortArray​(int[] arrayToSort)
        Override Sorter interface method to initiate binary tree sort.
        Specified by:
        sortArray in interface Sorter
        Parameters:
        arrayToSort - unsorted array of random integers.
        Returns:
        sorted array by calling getSortedTreeAsc()

      • initBinaryTree

        private void initBinaryTree​(int[] arrayToSort)
        Set the root node as the first value in the unsorted array, increment numberOfElements by 1 as a result. Add the rest of the values in the unsorted array to the tree and set sortedArray to have the same length as the number of unique values in the tree.
        Parameters:
        arrayToSort - unsorted array of random integers.

      • getRootElement

        Return the int value of the root element.

        value of root node.

        Returns:
        number of unique values.

      • addElements

        public void addElements​(int[] elements)
        Add unique values from the unsorted array to the tree. Skip the first (0th) value because it has already been set as the root node.
        Specified by:
        addElements in interface BinaryTreeInterface
        Parameters:
        elements - unsorted array from index 1.

      • addElement

        public void addElement​(int element)
        Add the first (0th) value from the unsorted array as the root node of the tree.
        Specified by:
        addElement in interface BinaryTreeInterface
        Parameters:
        element - unsorted array index 0.

      • getLeftChild

        public int getLeftChild​(int element)
                 throws ChildNotFoundException
        Use the argument value to find the node object assigned to it. From there check if that node has a child to its left (a lower value). If there is a child there, return its value. Otherwise throw ChildNotFoundException.
        Specified by:
        getLeftChild in interface BinaryTreeInterface
        Parameters:
        element - value of the parent node against which the method will try to find a left child.
        Returns:
        value of the child to the left of the parent node.
        Throws:
        ChildNotFoundException - thrown if the parent node has no child to its left.

      • getRightChild

        public int getRightChild​(int element)
                  throws ChildNotFoundException
        Use the argument value to find the node object assigned to it. From there check if that node has a child to its right (a higher value). If there is a child there, return its value. Otherwise throw ChildNotFoundException.
        Specified by:
        getRightChild in interface BinaryTreeInterface
        Parameters:
        element - value of the parent node against which the method will try to find a right child.
        Returns:
        value of the child to the right of the parent node.
        Throws:
        ChildNotFoundException - thrown if the parent node has no child to its right.

      • getSortedTreeAsc

        public int[] getSortedTreeAsc()
        Call traverseTreeAsc from the root node and to set the first value of the sorted array (nodeIndex = 0 at this point always). The method traverseTreeAsc will recursively call itself until sortedArray has been filled and this method can finally return the sorted array.
        Specified by:
        getSortedTreeAsc in interface BinaryTreeInterface
        Returns:
        sorted array.

      • getSortedTreeDesc

        public int[] getSortedTreeDesc()
        Unused at this version of the application.
        Specified by:
        getSortedTreeDesc in interface BinaryTreeInterface
        Returns:
        null

      • traverseTreeAsc

        private void traverseTreeAsc​(int element,
                             int index)
        This method will always be called with the root node and index 0 first. The method will try to go as far left down the tree as it can until there is no left child present, then it will assign that value to the current nodeIndex of sortedArray, increment nodeIndex by 1, then try and go down the right side of the tree. The method calls itself recursively until it has a null node as its argument.
        Parameters:
        element - value of current node
        index - index of sortedArray to assign value to

      • traverseTreeDesc

        private void traverseTreeDesc​(int element,
                              int index)
        Unused at this version of the application.
        Parameters:
        element - value of current node
        index - index of sortedArray to assign value to

      • userChoice

        private int[] userChoice()
        Unused at this version of the application.
        Returns:
        null

      • addNodeToTree

        private void addNodeToTree​(BinaryTreeSort.Node node,
                           int element)
        If the argument value is equal to the argument node, return null to ignore duplicate value. Otherwise compare argument value to value of argument node to determine if it will be a right child or a left child. Then check if their is an empty child node to assign the argument value to and if their isn't, recursively call the method with the same argument value, but the occupied child as the argument node. This will recur until the value is assigned its own node.
        Parameters:
        node - node the new value will be compared against.
        element - the value which needs to be added to the tree.

      • findNode

        private BinaryTreeSort.Node findNode​(int element)
        Start at the root node. Compare the argument value to the value of the current node. If they're equal then return that node, otherwise go to the next appropriate child node and check against that.
        Parameters:
        element - value for which there should be a corresponding node.
        Returns:
        node object of the argument value.
